titleStmt.title: Ephraim L. Van Winkle to Beriah Magoffin
CWG1410

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1859-1862

body.p: I met Mr Boyle at Nicholasville and he requests me to say to you that the East Tenn, expedition is abandoned He was then on his way to Cincinnati to inform Mr Nelson of the fact. I found all those in Garrard who were heretofore engaged in the enterprise fully determined upon immediate abandonment of the project this conclusion had been reached by them before my arrival there, doubtlessy Mr B had seen them.

Mr Boyle requests you to endeaver at once to prevent any action upon the part of Tennessee if in you powers. That you may assur assure the Tennessee authorities that no such enterprise is now in Contemplation -- I am happy to inform you of the successful termination of this dangerous organization to our peace & safety,
